snippet: Over the past decade, a federal eradication program has come close to eliminating nutria in the Delmarva Peninsula, but the large rodents have proved to be a resilient adversary.
abstract: Federal eradication program has come tantalizingly close to eliminating the invasive nutria population of the Delmarva Peninsula, a 200-mile-long isthmus that includes parts of Maryland, Delaware and Virginia; nutria, a type of large rodent, have had a devastating effect on the local ecosystem.
lead_paragraph: Over the past decade, a federal eradication program has come close to eliminating nutria in the Delmarva Peninsula, but the large rodents have proved to be a resilient adversary.

headline.seo: New War on Invasive Nutria in Delmarva Marshlands
headline.main: Killed by Thousands, Varmint Will Never Quit
headline.print_headline: New Phase in War on Nutria, a Voracious Invader of Marshlands
